body.name: Perfect Blue: Complete Metamorphosis (Light Novel) (Perfect Blue (Light Novel))

body.description: THE ORIGINAL NOVEL THAT INSPIRED THE CULT CLASSIC FILM BY SATOSHI KON Kirigoe Mima is in the third year of her career as a pure and innocent pop idol. Feeling like something big needs to change, she plans to give her image a major update. When the new Mima is revealed–complete with a sexy outfit and a risqué photo book–one of her most obsessive fans refuses to accept her transformation. To restore Mima to the innocent girl of her debut, he puts a terrifying plan to action that throws her life into chaos and mortal peril.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than the movie in my opinion
reviews.reviewText: I decided to get this book after falling in love with the movie but was a bit hesitant because everyone says the movie is way better and the story is different now the story is definitely a lot different the movie is much more inspired then based on the book I felt like I really love the book version though I think it very interesting and totally recommend if you’re into horror!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quick shipping; great condition
reviews.reviewText: The book came in pristine condition. I got the soft cover so with any other soft cover book you should be careful with bending the book so it keeps it shape. I’ve started reading it and so far I’m enjoying the story. I also bought the second book in this series and it came in the same great condition so I would definitely recommend this seller. I’ll be looking out for more books to purchase from them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Much different from the movie
reviews.reviewText: After watching the movie for the first time, I had seen that the book temporarily was on sale for a shocking price of only $4! I couldn't pass up that deal and decided to get it. Like I had heard before, the characters and story are different from the anime. I would say it was fun to read despite that since the characters were more likeable and the atmosphere wasn't as depressing at times. I will say the stalker's skin obsession creeped me out a bit and seemed to come out of nowhere. I would say if you liked the movie, go ahead and get the book. Just know that the source material is a completely different experience from the movie.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought the book because of the movie
reviews.reviewText: I loved the movie and the twists and turns it had taken and I wondered, how would one put that into writing? I bought the book and it was a whole new story from what I had expected. Some parts were written simply yet had that gory cringe to them but you have to keep reading to know why and how things turn out. I feel like the film had actually taken both books into account and combined it into one story, minus the gore and sexual parts. I just wish Yoshikazu Takeuchi had written more books to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this in late August after finally watching the anime and it came on time this afternoon. The translation is well done, the graphics/design are pleasing, and of course the story is brilliant. The fact that the rights were acquired not that long ago and it had been out of print for, what, over two decades in Japanese and (at least I think) never released in English at all, makes this a great book to own. Kudos to all that worked on this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Solid enough release, disappointing story
reviews.reviewText: My copy arrived fast and in perfect condition. It was larger than I expected, and the words are also larger than you'd think on wide-margined pages, so the book overall is a fairly short one. The translation is a lot smoother than most English releases of Japanese novels that I've read, but it still suffers a bit from being so careful in following basic writing rules that you can almost feel the writer straining as you read it. The most common example of this is the way it insists on referencing characters by their job titles, i.e., "The singer," to avoid repeating their names. It can be a good technique but it's used far too often and they should've rephrased some sentences instead in my opinion. There are two afterwards by the original author in the back, one from an earlier edition, one following the release of the movie. These are a nice bonus.Although this book is probably a huge treat to diehard fans of the famous anime film (which I have yet to see!), as a book in itself it is very flat and disappointing. There are far better mystery, thriller, and horror novels written in any language, and there is little to no substance beyond attempted suspense in this one. True, it does address the issues of fame and the obsessive fans, but it certainly isn't the only (or best) book to do so. It is not structured in a particularly suspenseful or interesting way. It includes details that aren't particularly relevant or interesting, and it jumps around from one dull scene to another, each from the perspective of a flat character. The most interesting character is the antagonist, but even he isn't too fleshed out. The author does have a good understanding of human emotions and how they change and develop during unusual situations, and I appreciated this, but it doesn't make up for the overall shallow book.Just an FYI in case anyone wonders, this book contains graphic sexual and violent content, so be forewarned. It is not excessive or out of place in the slightest, and the sexual content is brief enough to skip if you so desire. The book also has disturbing elements such as child molestation.Overall, I think whatever caused the film to be a "cult classic" isn't in this book, and I can only assume that's because the movie did in fact deviate a great deal from its source material. Worth the read for a diehard fan only.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A cool book for fans of the Film
reviews.reviewText: The events in the book differ from the film, but its cool to read the origin story for the Satoshi Kon film. I love both the book and film as they both have something special to offer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good read
reviews.reviewText: I have seen the movie a few times but I liked the book better. Quick read I finished it over a weekend, it drew me in right off the jump. Highly recommend for fans of the film or any thriller fan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Have you ever read something with one hand in front of your face half the time?That’s what this book does
As the name suggest,everything was perfect from delivery to packaging.Superb storytelling.Go for it.
Keep in mind that this isnt a manga its just a regular book

reviews.reviewTitle: The novel that inspired one of my favorite movies
reviews.reviewText: It is different, very different from the film, but still retains the same spine-chilling suspense it has. A perfect companion for the movie, as in a different version with most of the same characters and new ones.Pick this up if you really liked the film, or if you're into books with suspense stories with a straightforward plot..

reviews.reviewTitle: Llego en excelentes condiciones y antes del tiempo esperado
reviews.reviewText: A mi hijo le encantó me dijo que cumplió sus expectativas, llegó en buen estado y antes de tiempo.Buena compra
